title: Calories in Guac
meta_description: Discover calories in guac per 100g serving, including fat, carbs, protein, fiber, and tips for variations in this avocado-based dip.
assumptions: Homemade guacamole: mashed avocado, tomato, onion, lime juice, cilantro, salt; no added oil or dairy.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ripeness of ingredients, brand (for store-bought), and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of guacamole provides ~157 kcal, mostly from healthy fats in avocado.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: With extra olive oil (1 tsp per 100g)

faqs.q: How many calories in a typical serving of guac?
faqs.a: A standard 2 tbsp (about 30g) serving has ~47 kcal.
Yes, ~15g fat per 100g, but mostly healthy monounsaturated fats from avocado.
Guac is higher (~157 kcal/100g) due to avocado; salsa is lower (~30 kcal/100g).

faqs.q: Does store-bought guac have more calories?
faqs.a: Often yes, due to added preservatives or oils; check labels for exact values.
About 6.7g per 100g, mainly from avocado and veggies.
